Class BufferPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.cs.kjsmith.BufferPool

  • public class BufferPool
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the entire available buffer of memory

                                   int frameID)
        Reads a block into the specific frame from disk
        Parameters:
        id - Block ID to load
        frameID - the frame ID to place the block in
        Returns:
        True if block was successfully loaded, false otherwise

      • hasEmptyFrames

        public java.lang.Boolean hasEmptyFrames()
        Checks if the BufferPool has any empty frames
        Returns:
        True if there are empty frames, false otherwise

      • getEmptyFrame

        public int getEmptyFrame()
        Finds the first empty frame in memory
        Returns:
        The index for an empty frame if one is found, -1 if no empty frames exist

      • evictBlock

        public java.lang.Boolean evictBlock(int blockID)
        Removes a specific block from memory. If the dirty bit is set, write the block to memory.
        Parameters:
        blockID - The block to evict
        Returns:
        True if the block was evicted, false otherwise

      • evictBlock

        public java.lang.Integer evictBlock()
        Removes the LRU block from memory
        Returns:
        The block number that was evicted, -1 if no blocks could be removed

      • writeBlock

        public boolean writeBlock(int block)
        Returns a specified block to disk
        Parameters:
        block - The block to write
        Returns:
        True if block is written successfully, false otherwise
